bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, November 28, 1924

div1.p: Carter sends Frost the second section of his yellow fever manuscript.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, November 28, 1924
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. BIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROIZ
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
/LC
YELLOW FEVER COUNCIL
HENRY R. CARTER, M. D.
HIDEYO NOGUCHI, M. D.
JOSEPH H. WHITE, M. D.
2122 California St; N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
November 28, 1924.
My Dear Doctor Frost:
div1.p:
I am sending you herewith the 2nd. Section of my MSS--the
one immediately preceeding that which you have. You also have
Section 1 (Epidemiology) from the I. H. B.

As I said, I do not think a knowledge of Section 11 is neces-
sary for the understanding of Section 111, on which I especially
wish your criticism, but since you seem to think so--here it is.

I delayed sending it until I could revise it and make such
changes: elisions and additions as seemed advisable. It is now in
what, I hope, is its complete form.

Laura returned Tuesday--as you can tell by the inserts being
typewritten--I think much improved by her brief absence, which did
not seem altogether brief to me. Commend both of us to Mrs. Frost
and Miss Susan.
div1.closer:
Very truly your friend, H. R. Carter Enclosure.
The preference to pages in
pencil, are to pages in
sects II as you have it for
your own conve-
nience: Those in ink are
for the pages, numbered in
the MS. as a whole & are of no
use to you
H. R C
